title: Hint
text:
1) Write down the system of equations:
$$x$$ - $$y$$ $$=$$ $$-1$$ …(1)
$$2x$$ - $$y$$ $$=$$ $$-5$$ …(2)

2) Subtract equation (1) from equation (2) to eliminate y:
(2x - y) - (x - y) $$=$$ $$-5$$ - $$(-1)$$
$$2x$$ - $$y$$ - $$x$$ + $$y$$ $$=$$ $$-5$$ + $$1$$
$$x$$ $$=$$ $$-4$$

3) Substitute $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-4$$ back into one of the original equations (say, (1)):
$$x$$ - $$y$$ $$=$$ $$-1$$
$$-4$$ - $$y$$ $$=$$ $$-1$$
$$-y$$ $$=$$ $$-1$$ + $$4$$
$$-y$$ $$=$$ $$3$$
$$y$$ $$=$$ $$-3$$

4) Therefore, the unique solution to the system is (x, y) $$=$$ $$(-4,-3)$$. Any ordered pair other than $$(-4,-3)$$ will not satisfy both equations simultaneously.

Answer: The ordered pair is a solution to the system.
